common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS updates failing or the application not launching on Windows and macOS. This can be due to antivirus software flagging, App Installer bugs, or problems with previous installations. Solutions include whitelisting Pieces OS in antivirus software, updating App Installer, reinstalling Pieces OS, or contacting support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Trojan Attack Updating Pieces OS to 11.2.1 Version
related_issues.text:
Trojan Attack Updating Pieces OS to 11.2.1 Version
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Today I got the notification from Pieces Software to update new version 11.2.1 I downloaded, and I tried to Install the application my antivirus terminated the process to install, and I got the report please ensure at your end.

`Event: Process terminated
Application: Setup/Uninstall
User: HARIPRASATH\Hari Prasath
User type: Initiator
Component: System Watcher
Result description: Terminated
Type: Trojan
Name: PDM:Trojan.Win32.Generic
Threat level: High
Object type: Process
Object path: C:\CondaTemp\Update-cb1fe563-b25b-4892-a950-60d71f0eed64
Object name: out-windows.exe
MD5: D40CB08BE832B0EFCFB23BE85D893AAF`
## Summary of GitHub Issue Discussion

**Key points:**

* User HarryLesnar24 reported that their antivirus flagged PiecesOS as malicious.
* This is due to PiecesOS needing to monitor the system for the LTM-2 engine to function.
* Antivirus software often detects this as suspicious activity.

**Solutions:**

* The user should report the flag as a false positive to their antivirus vendor.
* The user should add PiecesOS as an exception in their antivirus settings.

**Outcome:**

* The user confirmed they will contact their antivirus support team and take the necessary steps.

**Current status:**

* This issue is considered resolved. 

## Additional Notes:

* The user was proactively offered alternative solutions to the issue. 
* The development team provided clear explanations and linked relevant resources for user reference.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Performance Issues and Errors
common_issues.description: Users reported performance issues with Pieces OS, including high CPU usage, lag, and errors. These issues were often linked to Long Term Memory and specific applications like Discord. Solutions included hotfixes, switching to local processing modes, and reinstalling the app and OS.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* epikkoder reported high CPU usage on PiecesOS.
* Discord specifically exhibits hiccups and high CPU usage.

**Problems Identified:**

* High overall CPU usage.
* Lag and hiccups on Discord.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team worked on a hotfix for the issue.
* The hotfix was released and epikkoder was asked to confirm if performance improved.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Hotfix improved performance, but epikkoder still experiences occasional hiccups on Discord and high CPU usage during work sessions.
* Further investigation and troubleshooting are needed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was reported on March 4th, 2025.
* A hotfix was released on March 5th, 2025.
* epikkoder provided an image showcasing high CPU usage.

related_issues.title: Pieces Copilot not working with local processing mode
related_issues.text:
Pieces Copilot not working with local processing mode
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I set ML Processing Mode to Local, the pieces copilot stops working saying this feature works with blended processing. I sent a simple hello message and it mentions on website that I can use it on local.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aa9370bd-4089-41d3-8f79-dbc2fb654635)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57a6a86d-99e7-4354-ab47-47456155ada9)

I tried using local modal (LLaMa 3.2 3B) which is relatively small size for fast response but it is stuck on thinking phase. This model is working on ollama but not on pieces desktop with local processing mode.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a3242cf3-831f-45ce-a1a2-222c73cb703d)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @AkhilTrivediX is experiencing an error when using a cloud-based LLM in Pieces despite running in local-only mode.

**Problem Identified:**

* Pieces is preventing data from being sent to the cloud when in local-only mode, causing an error when trying to use a cloud-based LLM.

**Solution Proposed/Implemented:**

* Use a local LLM instead of a cloud-based LLM.
* Pieces will guide users to local LLMs when a cloud-based LLM is selected in local-only mode.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User is provided with instructions on how to switch to a local LLM.
* Pieces will adjust the error message to direct users to local LLMs.

**Additional Information:**

* The user is encouraged to explore different local LLM options to find the best fit for their needs.

**Overall, the issue has been resolved by guiding the user to use a local LLM instead of a cloud-based LLM while in local-only mode.**

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Mistral Model Download Issues

**Key Points:**

* User (@msaqibbop) reported an issue with the Mistral 8 7b model download getting stuck on initialization and not responding to stop commands.
* Another user (@AkhilTrivediX) confirmed facing the same issue.
* The issue seems to be related to specific system configurations and not universally reproducible.

**Problems Identified:**

* Mistral 8 7b model download getting stuck on initialization.
* Stop download button not functioning.
* Clicking the stop button repeatedly leads to further issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Temporary fix:** Delete all files from `C:/Users/[YOUR-USERNAME]/Documents/com.pieces.os/` and reinstall Pieces OS and desktop app.
* Solution proposed by @mark-at-pieces: Gather more information about the user's machine to pinpoint the cause.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists and requires further investigation.
* A long-term solution is being worked on in the form of a complete replacement of the Local Large Language Model stack within the next 2-3 weeks.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user can schedule a real-time chat with @mark-at-pieces for further assistance.
* Other attempted fixes, such as reinstalling Ollama and disconnecting from the internet, were unsuccessful.

recommendations: **Prioritize 'Pieces OS Update and Launch Issues':** This is the most frequent common issue, impacting both Windows and macOS users. Focus on resolving root causes related to antivirus flagging, App Installer bugs, and installation problems.

**Address 'Pieces OS Performance Issues and Errors':** Investigate and optimize Pieces OS performance, particularly high CPU usage linked to Long Term Memory and applications like Discord. Consider improving communication about local processing modes.
